artist: Artist: Sebald Beham; Artist: After Agostino d' Musi
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: reclining nude woman lying on side with her back to viewer, looking toward ground; a boy stands behind the woman, resting his hand on her head, looking toward similar point on the ground; another nude figure crawls on all fours at L; foliage and castle in background
inscription:
Signature, Title, Stamp

in graphite on verso: 121693.1 | B215 | [circle with tiny circle inside in, followed by period | | G71 | MXXX
markings: on verso: stamp at lower left: Paul Davidsohn (Lugt 654); brown stamp in lower left quadrant: Theodor Apel (Lugt 16a)
provenance: Paul Davidsohn, Grunewald-Berlin, sale 1920; Theodor Apel (1884-1949), Ermlitz; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, upper left: [HSB]; title in plate, upper left: [.S. IOHANES. CRISOSTOMVS.] (with final \"o\" in superscript)
title: Penance of St. John Chrysostomus
